gov_en: GOVERNMENT OF INDIA / MINISTRY OF HOME AFFAIRS
news_ticker_alert: ‚ö° Cybersecurity Alert: Phishing attacks rise by 30% | üîí Government releases new cybersecurity guidelines | üõ°Ô∏è Protect your online accounts with MFA
hero_subtitle: Your trusted platform for reporting online fraud, cyberbullying, and other digital crimes.
register_complaint_desc: File a complaint and upload evidence such as URLs, APK files, emails, screenshots, and other proof related to the cybercrime incident.
track_complaint_desc: Check the real-time status of your submitted complaint using your complaint ID and registered mobile number.
learning_portal_desc: Explore cybersecurity tips, digital safety guidelines, awareness videos, and educational materials to stay protected online.
gov_links_desc: Access official portals including DigiLocker, CyberDost, Digital India, and other verified government resources.
volunteer_desc: Join the Cyber Volunteer Program to help protect the online community and report harmful content.
financial_fraud_desc: Includes UPI scams, online banking fraud, credit/debit card misuse, and fake investment schemes.
identity_theft_desc: Stealing personal information such as Aadhaar, PAN, or bank details for illegal activities.
cyberstalking_desc: Harassment, threatening messages, or stalking through social media or other online platforms.
malware_desc: Viruses, ransomware, spyware, and malicious apps that steal or damage your data.
step1_desc: Capture screenshots, URLs, emails, phone numbers, or any proof related to the cyber incident.
step2_desc: Fill out the online complaint form with accurate details and upload supporting evidence.
step3_desc: Authorities will verify your complaint and forward it to the respective cyber cell.
step4_desc: Use your complaint ID to monitor the status and receive updates.
